review_blob: Pint at brewery. Good aroma, hoppy. Citrus, evergreen. Clean golden yellow color, ok head and lace. Bitter sweet flavor. Medium body, smooth creamy mouthfeel. Sweet bitter finish. Thats nice. Good fruity pale ale, on the tangerine side of things.

At Ruckus Pizza Morrisville. Good aroma, fruity. Clean reddish pink color, ok head and lace. Medium sour flavor. Light body, thin smooth mouthfeel, sweet and sour finish. Thats nice. Very easy drinking. Good fruit to tart ratio in flavor, which is the best part.

Bottle, from Bottle Revolution RDU. Good aroma. Citrus, tart. Tad hazed, golden yellow color, small head minor lace. Moderate sour flavor. Light body, thin smooth mouthfeel, sour finish. Thats good, nice mix of hops and salt.

Pint at Lonerider. Good aroma, salt and rose hips. Tad hazed pale pink orange color, no head, minor lace. Light sour flavor. Thin body smooth creamy mouthfeel sweet finish its good, fun, could use thiamin the hotter weather. Flavor best part, IMO.

Pint at Ruckus Pizza Morrisville. Good aroma hoppy, grassy lemony. Just a tad hazed orangey gold color, good head and lace. Bitter flavor. Light body, thin smooth creamy mouthfeel bitter finish. Man thats good. Real good aroma and flavor. Very good, great timing for the season. I like it.
beer_name: Foothills Hop of the Month April (Kazbek)

review_blob: Bottle, from Bottle Revolution RDU. Good aroma. Malty. Chocolate coffee. Dark orangey brown color, good head and lace. Sweet flavor. Heavy body, thick creamy mouthfeel, sweet finish. Darn tasty hides ABV well. Flavor best part, big sweet chocolate impy stout. Aroma, tad less interesting, but solid. Real good offering from Pisgah.

bottle, from, hmm, I forget. dammit. anyway, good aroma, hoppy, fruity, melon, like cantelope or honey dew. hazed golden orange color, big head, fluffy, spotty lace. Sweet flavor. Medium body, creamy smooth mouthfeel, sweet finish witha minor bitter streak, its good, surpised at how big a head I got as it was in my fridge for a couple week, and I poured cautiously, but aroma is nice, best part IMO, flavor good too but not as interesting
beer_name: Foothills Hop of the Month: March (Topaz)

review_blob: bottle, from a Lowes supermaket at High House and Cary Parkway, part of the ipa 12 pack. good aroma, hoppy, clean golden orange color, good head and lace. Bitter sweet flavor. Medium body, creamy sticky mouthfeel, bitter sweet finish thats kind of dry. interesting, aroma woody, on the cedar side, grassy scent the strongest, moderately bitter, escpecially on the finish, not super different from other SN ipa s but worth a tick.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada Five Hop Experimental IPA

review_blob: Pint at Brewery. Good aroma, yeasty hoppy. Tad hazed orange gold. Small head minor lace. Sweet flavor. Medium body, thin smooth mouthfeel, sweet finish. Its good good citrus and herb. On aroma.

Bottle, from.....I forget. Good aroma malty, coffee & chocolate. Dark orange brown color, ok head, faded to a ring, not much lace. Sweet flavor. Medium body, smooth creamy mouthfeel, sweet finish. Its good, hides its abv well, flavor best part imo, tad earthy aroma. Solid coffee impy.
beer_name: Wicked Weed El Paraiso Coffee Stout

review_blob: bottle, from.... I forget. ok aroma, mild funk, mild fruit. litely cloudy reddish brown color, no head or lace, medium sour flavor.. medium body, thin smooth mouthfeel, sweet and sour finish, its ok, more on the fruity side than sour side, drinks easy. its ok overall, not gonna wow anyone here.

Bottle, from...I forget. Good aroma, malty. Cereal, clean light brownish orange color, ok head and lace. Sweet flavor. Heavy body creamy oily mouthfeel, sweet finish. Interesting, big sweet brew. Aroma best part, IMO. Get a lot of the cardamom and cinnamon. Flavor more of the barrel. Fun to try, wouldnt drink alotnof it, but good for a rate.

bottle, from State of Beer Raleigh. good aroma, sweet, coffee, duh, chocolate. dark brownish black color, good initial head, faded quick, ok lace. Sweet flavor. medium body, creamy mouthfeel, sweet roasted bitter finish. its good, flavor best part IMO, good coffee malt mix. nice finish also, again the coffee
beer_name: Terrapin Single Origin Coffee Stout: Ethiopia Hambela

review_blob: can, from brewery. best by 05/11/16. ok aroma, hoppy, fruity citrus. clean golden orange color, ok head and lace. bitter sweet flavor. Light body, creamy mouthfeel, crisp bitter finish. its good, I was a little concerned how old it was, i found it mentioned on Loneriders blog from 06/21/15, but glad its ok, wold like to have a fresh batch, but that involves me getting my butt to LR more often. solid session ipa,

Can, from Wholefoods Cary. 02/26/16 on bottom of can, assuming its a packing date. Ok aroma, sweet.fruity.tad hazed,brownish orange color,,ok head, little to no lace. Bitter sweet flavor. Lite body, thin smooth mouthfeel, bitter sweet finish. Its ok. Little weak even for a session IPA. Aroma best part. Pleasant citrus scent. Flavor tad less interesting.
Pint at Brewery. Good aroma, malty. Blackish brown color, real good head and lace. Sweet flavor. Light body, thin smooth mouthfeel, lightly bitter roast finish, its good, classic "Irish" stout.

1/2 pint at Brewey. Ok aroma, malty, clean dark orangey brown color, ok head that faded quick. Minor lace. Sweet flavor, heavy body creamy mouthfeel, sweet finish. Its ok, but it might be me not. Digging old ales overall. Flavor best part little chocolate and woodiness about it.

botttle, from State of Beer, Raleigh. ok aroma, Malty. coffee, blackish brown color, ok head and lace. sweet bitter flavor. medium body, thick creamy gritty mouthfeel, bitter sweet finish, its ok, bit seems weal compared to other coffee stouts.
beer_name: Terrapin Single Origin Coffee Stout: Hawaii Kona

review_blob: bottle, from State of Beer Raleigh, good aroma, malty. coffee (duh) chocolate. Blackish brown color, ok head and lace. medium sweetness, lightly bitter flavor. medium body, creamy, thick feel, average carbonation, bitter sweet finish, Its good, not wowing me, but solid.
beer_name: Terrapin Single Origin Coffee Stout: Guatemala Huehuetenango

review_blob: Pint at Pharmacy bottle and beverage. Good aroma, hoppy, citrus. Clean golden orange color, good head that faded quick, ok lace. Sweet bitter flavor. Medium body, creamy oily mouthfeel, bitter sweet finish. Darn good IPA, nice citrusy aroma, lemon rules the day, solid offering from Ponysaurus

bottle, from the Beer Dispensary, Apex. ok aroma, mild hops,pine/evergreen tad oxidized, mild toffee, cereal malt, clean golden orange color, ok head and lace. bitter sweet flavor medium body, creamy sticky mouthfeel, bitter finish. its ok, little oxidized, flavor best part, IMO,

bottle, from the Beer Dispensary Apex. good aroma, fruity, citrus and berry. clean golden orange color, ok head and lace. bitter sweet flavor. medium body, oily creamy mouthfeel, bitter sweet finish. best of the bunch, of the 4, 6. 8 series. aroma and flavor are both real good.

bottle, from Bottle Revolution RDU. Winter 2016 good aroma, malty, chocolate and vanilla. dark orangy brown color, ok head and lace. sweet flavor. medium body smmoth creamy mouthfeel, sweet finish. its nice, not gonna wow you, but solid. flavor best part, IMO. drinkks easy. good chocolate and vanilla.

can, from Bottle Revolution RDU. batch #001 ok aroma, citrusy. grassy. tad hazed orange gold color, ok head and lace. bitter sweet flavor. medium body, creamy oily mouthfeel, bitter dry finish. its good, solid IPA. flavor best part, IMO. good mouthfeel, aroma a little weaker than flavor in the scheme of the things. worth a try, would drink everyday also

bottle, from State of Beer, Raleigh. good aroma, chocolate, roasty, coffee. brown color, ok head and lace. medium body, creamy mouthfeel, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, dryish finish, its nice, solid coffee stout. nothing to wow you, fun to try. like flavor tad bit more than aroma, but fairly even between the two. finish has a harsh streak.
beer_name: Terrapin Single Origin Coffee Stout: Sumatra Wahana Natural

review_blob: bottle, from State of Beer, Raleigh. date 16039. good aroma, fruity. citrus and apricot. Clean golden orange color, ok head that faded quick, no lace. Sweet bitter flavor. Medium body, oily creamy mouthfeel, bitter sweet finish. thats nice, Flavor little better than aroma, but not by much. nice addition to sculpin woith pineapple.

bottle, from Bottle Revolution RDU. ok aroma, citrus and pine. toasted malt. hazed brownish orange color, ok head and lace, bitter sweet flavor. light body, thin smooth mouthfeel, mild bitter finish. its fine, nothing wowing me, but drinkable.

bottle, from Bottle Revolution RDU. Good aroma, malty, lesser hops. Clean yellow gold color, ok head and lace. sweet bitter flavor. light body thin smooth mouthfeel, crisp bitter finish its fine, odd choice for the month of February, as far as a pilsner, but it doesnt wow me, perfectly adequate.
beer_name: Foothills Hop of the Month: February (Mandarina)

review_blob: Pint at Bottle Revolution RDU. Mild hops and malt. Well not mild, but not a punch you in the face aroma. Hazed brownish orange Coke, ok head and lace. Bitter sweet flavor. Heavy body, creamy oily mouthfeel, bitter dry sweet finish. Its good , not wowing me, but good. As it warms aroma getting better. Kind of home brewing though

Pint at Bottle Revolution RDU good aroma mildly hoppy, cloudy golden yellow color, good head and lace. Bitter sweet flavor. Light body, thin creamy mouthfeel, bitter finish, its ok. On the lemon side of hoppiness.

bottle, from Bottle Revolution RDU, ok aroma, maltydark orangy brown color, good head, though I poured agressively ok lace, sweet flavor. medium body, creamy mouthfeel, sweet finish. meh, kind of a mess, IMO, doesnt blend well, salt makes it brackish.
beer_name: Ass Clown Dark Chocolate Sea Salt

review_blob: bottle 02/09/16 from Bottle Revolution Raleigh. Good aroma, hoppy, fruity citrus, fleshy fruits, clean golden orange color, good head that faded quick, ok lace. bitter sweet flavor. medium body, oily creamy mouthfeel, bitter finish. its good, classic hop bomb from Knee Deep. aroma best part IMO. nice citrus apricot mix, more lemon/ grapefruit on finish. solid, but nothing Im going nuts over.

Pint at Ruckus Pizza Morrisville. Ok aroma mild tart fruitiness, clean pale pinkish red. Ok head and lace. Sour flavor light body thin smooth mouthfeel sweet and sour finish. Its fine, I might like it better when its hot out.

Can, from Bottle Revolution Raleigh. Good aroma, hoppy, on the citrus side. Toffee caramel. Clean golden orange color, ok head not much lace. Sweet flavor. Medium body, smooth creamy mouthfeel, sweet finish. Its ok, dont like the direction the flavor and finish go from the aroma. Aroma is best part.

bottle, from Bottle Revolution RDU, good aroma, sweet, malty barrelly (is that a word, ha ha) good mix on malt and barrel. dark orangy black color, not much head or lace, small ring for a while though, sweet flavor. heavy body, thick creamy mouthfeel, sweet dry finish. its a solid BBA stout, feel like the mix of big oatmeal stout and barrel is mixed well in aroma, flavor is more on the barrel side of things, though oatmeal gives it enough flavor to hold up. mouthfeel is good too. having this while its still cold here in NC, which after Febuary is a questionable, RBC is a good brewer overall,
beer_name: Raleigh The Millers Toll- Bourbon Barrel Aged

review_blob: can, from Bottle Revolution RDU. good aroma, sweet, bourbon and chocolate. dark orangy brown color, good initial head, ok lace. sweet flavor. heavy body, thick creamy mouthfeel, bitter bourbon finish, its good, though I think its a tad harsh, bourbon is strong, not totally overwhelming, but dominates the aroma and finish.

Snifter at Ruckus Pizza Morrisville. Good aroma, sweet . Fruity malty. Orange and caramel. Reddish orange color ok head that faded quick, not much lace. Bitter sweet flavor. Medium body, smooth creamy mouthfeel, bitter sweet finish, its good good mix of hops and malt. Solid but tad unspectacular.

Bottle, from Publix Ft Meyers. Good aroma, sweet grapefruit orange. Golden orange color,!ok head and lace . Bitter sweet flavor. Medium body, thin smooth mouthfeel, bitter sweet flavor. Its good, real grapefruit punch, not wowing me, but drinkable

12 oz pour at Stillwater Grille Ft Meyers. Ok aroma, sweet. Citrus, pineapple and orange. Mild coriander. Brownish orange color, ok head and lace. Sweet flavor. Medium body creamy oily mouthfeel, bitter sweet finish. Its ok. Not a lot of Belgian for me. Flavor best part. IMO. Just ok in the scheme of things
beer_name: Point Ybel A Blow To The Head

review_blob: Can, from Total wine Ft Meyers, ok aroma, sweet, fruity citrus , lemon grapefruit. Tad hazed golden orange color, ok head and lace. Bitter sweet flavor, medium body, smooth creamy mouthfeel, bitter sweet finish. Its good, fine enough drinking IPA , not gonna wow you, but fine if you are drinking local

Pint at Tylers Apex. Good aroma, sweet, fruity. Red berry streak, toasty malt. Bronze orange color, good head and lace. Bitter sweet flavor. Medium body, smooth creamy mouthfeel, sweet finish. Interesting mix of German, which Im think more alt than kolsch and hops. Drinks easy. Flavor best part, IMO, nice fruity malty mix.

10oz pour at Tylers Apex. Good aroma, sweet, chocolate, roasted malt. Dark blackish brown color, ok head, no lace. Sweet flavor. Medium body, smooth creamy mouthfeel, sweet finish. Nice solid milk stout.

Bottle, from Bottle Revolution RDU. Good aroma, sweet, toasty sweet nutty malt, light citrus hop. On the lemon, lime side. Clean brownish orange color,good head and lace. Sweet flavor. Medium body, thin creamy mouthfeel, crisp sweet finish with a little bite. Its nice, classic American Vienna. I like the flavor most, nice easy drinking brew.
beer_name: Foothills Hop of the Month: January (Wakatu)

review_blob: 32oz growler, from brewery. good aroma, sweet. vanilla, lemon, orange, clean brownish orange color, good head that faded quickly, ok lace. biiter sweet flavor. medium body smooth creamy mouthfeel, bitter sweet finish, huh, well, that is a surprise, the vanilla is strong, but its well made overall, just wehn you think the vanilla is too much the hops kick in with a nice citrus streak.

Pint at Ruckus Pizza Morrisville. Good aroma, sweet. Orange peach. Clean golden orange color, ok head and lace. Sweet flavor. Light body, thin watery mouthfeel, sweet finish. Its ok overall has a stake smoke on the finish that I get with some IPA"s that doesnt show up in aroma.

bottle, from the Beer Dispensary, though Ive seen else where in the area. Real good aroma, sweet, pineapple, Pine, juniper. clean golden orange color, ok head and lace. bitter sweet flavor. Medium body dense creamy mouthfeel, sweet finish, thats nice, I was apprehensive by the deScription, but it works well. aroma and flavor are wonderful. great brew overall

bottle, from the Beer Dispensary Apex. 02/14/16 edition. good aroma, sweet. pine smokey roasty. dark orangy brown color, ok head and laceBitter sweet flavor. medium body, light creamy mouthfeel, Btter finish. a classic zblack spa. linguring bitterness on finish, on the pine side of thing in botharoma and finish.

bottle, from the Beer Dispensary Apex NC. good aroma, sweet, fruity. pineapple, coconut, mango. clean brownish orange color, ok head and lace, though I poured carefully. Bitter sweet flavor. medium body, oil creamy mouthfeel, bitter sweet finish. interesting in aroma and flavor. that coconut thing Im getting is what grabs my attention. solid ipa

bottle, from High Craft, good aroma, sweet. bourbon, coffee, vanilla, moderate yeasty funk. dark cloudy brownish orange color, ok head and lace, medium sour sweet flavor. medium body still creamy mouthfeel, sour finish, thats nice. aroma best part, IMO, flavor more funky bitter withourt the other aspects of the aroma.

bottle, from Bottle Revolution RDU. ok aroma, sweet. strong cereal grain, little yeastiness mix of citrus and blueberry. just a tad cloudy brownish orange color, good head, ok lace. Bitter sweet flavor. medium body smooth creamy mouthfeel, sweet finish, its ok, not quite coming together for me not sure if its the yeast or if its suffering from a little rot, could be bitter blueberries, but fun attempt just not one to excite me.
